title: Friction - describe motion of box on ramp

content.question: A box is initially held at rest on a ramp with an incline of <math alttext="37 degrees" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msup><mn>37</mn><mo>âˆ˜</mo></msup></math> with respect to the horizontal and then released. The coefficients of static and kinetic friction between the box and the ramp are <math alttext="0.50" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.50</mn></math> and <math alttext="0.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>0.20</mn></math>, respectively. Which of the following best describes the motion, if any, of the box after it is released?

choices.label: The box will remain at rest on the incline.
The box will start sliding down the incline at a constant velocity.
The box will start sliding down the incline and then slow down at a constant rate.
The box will start sliding down the incline and then continue to speed up at a constant rate.

content.answer: The box will start sliding down the incline and then continue to speed up at a constant rate.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
